{"theme":{"id":"theme","version":"1.0","startStage":"5bd72e1d-9b57-4d4e-9240-d02d16958426","stage":[{"x":0,"y":0,"w":100,"h":100,"id":"5bd72e1d-9b57-4d4e-9240-d02d16958426","rotate":null,"config":{"__cdata":"{\"opacity\":100,\"strokeWidth\":1,\"stroke\":\"rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)\",\"autoplay\":false,\"visible\":true,\"color\":\"#FFFFFF\",\"genieControls\":true,\"instructions\":\"\"}"},"param":[{"name":"next","value":"3c8b9c9b-e95b-413e-ae9b-5593b759d168"}],"manifest":{"media":[]},"org.ekstep.text":[{"x":6.39,"y":16.54,"minWidth":20,"w":81.91,"maxWidth":500,"fill":"#000000","fontStyle":"normal","fontWeight":"normal","stroke":"rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)","strokeWidth":1,"opacity":1,"editable":false,"version":"V2","offsetY":0.04,"h":70.31,"rotate":0,"textType":"text","lineHeight":1,"z-index":0,"font":"NotoSans","fontsize":48,"weight":"","id":"56051479-38d4-44d3-9b40-be707e76e659","config":{"__cdata":"{\"opacity\":100,\"strokeWidth\":1,\"stroke\":\"rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)\",\"autoplay\":false,\"visible\":true,\"text\":\"Algebra (from Arabic \\\"al-jabr\\\", literally meaning \\\"reunion of broken parts\\\"[1]) is one of the broad parts of mathematics, together with number theory, geometry and analysis. In its most general form, algebra is the study of mathematical symbols and the rules for manipulating these symbols;[2] it is a unifying thread of almost all of mathematics.[3] As such, it includes everything from elementary equation solving to the study of abstractions such as groups, rings, and fields. The more basic parts of algebra are called elementary algebra; the more abstract parts are called abstract algebra or modern algebra. Elementary algebra is generally considered to be essential for any study of mathematics, science, or engineering, as well as such applications as medicine and economics. Abstract algebra is a major area in advanced mathematics, studied primarily by professional mathematicians.\",\"color\":\"#000000\",\"fontfamily\":\"NotoSans\",\"fontsize\":18,\"fontweight\":false,\"fontstyle\":false,\"align\":\"left\"}"}}]},{"x":0,"y":0,"w":100,"h":100,"id":"3c8b9c9b-e95b-413e-ae9b-5593b759d168","rotate":null,"config":{"__cdata":"{\"opacity\":100,\"strokeWidth\":1,\"stroke\":\"rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)\",\"autoplay\":false,\"visible\":true,\"color\":\"#FFFFFF\",\"genieControls\":true,\"instructions\":\"\"}"},"param":[{"name":"previous","value":"5bd72e1d-9b57-4d4e-9240-d02d16958426"},{"name":"next","value":"56b07655-a3be-4050-b389-e7e681287e84"}],"manifest":{"media":[]},"org.ekstep.text":[{"x":12.08,"y":17.53,"minWidth":20,"w":76.08,"maxWidth":500,"fill":"#000000","fontStyle":"normal","fontWeight":"normal","stroke":"rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)","strokeWidth":1,"opacity":1,"editable":false,"version":"V2","offsetY":0.04,"h":50.22,"rotate":0,"textType":"text","lineHeight":1,"z-index":0,"font":"NotoSans","fontsize":48,"weight":"","id":"db5bab6a-99c1-4073-acc5-750eace60ec8","config":{"__cdata":"{\"opacity\":100,\"strokeWidth\":1,\"stroke\":\"rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)\",\"autoplay\":false,\"visible\":true,\"text\":\"Elementary algebra differs from arithmetic in the use of abstractions, such as using letters to stand for numbers that are either unknown or allowed to take on many values.[4] For example, in the letter x is unknown, but the law of inverses can be used to discover its value: x=3. I the letters E and {\\\\displaystyle m} m are variables, and the letter {\\\\displaystyle c} c is a constant, the speed of light in a vacuum. Algebra gives methods for writing formulas and solving equations that are much clearer and easier than the older method of writing everything out in words.\",\"color\":\"#000000\",\"fontfamily\":\"NotoSans\",\"fontsize\":18,\"fontweight\":false,\"fontstyle\":false,\"align\":\"left\"}"}}]},{"x":0,"y":0,"w":100,"h":100,"id":"56b07655-a3be-4050-b389-e7e681287e84","rotate":null,"config":{"__cdata":"{\"opacity\":100,\"strokeWidth\":1,\"stroke\":\"rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)\",\"autoplay\":false,\"visible\":true,\"color\":\"#FFFFFF\",\"genieControls\":true,\"instructions\":\"\"}"},"param":[{"name":"previous","value":"3c8b9c9b-e95b-413e-ae9b-5593b759d168"},{"name":"next","value":"1d505532-e5ee-4076-b70b-ed5ee90db94e"}],"manifest":{"media":[]},"org.ekstep.richtext":[{"type":"rect","x":13.33,"y":9.14,"fill":"rgba(0, 0, 0, 0)","opacity":1,"w":15,"h":7.65,"rotate":0,"z-index":0,"fontSize":37.33,"id":"bb61c432-0215-4b39-8c36-ce11e9a9242d","config":{"__cdata":"{\"opacity\":100,\"autoplay\":false,\"visible\":true,\"text\":\"

Etymology

\\n\"}"}}],"org.ekstep.text":[{"x":13.33,"y":29.38,"minWidth":20,"w":65.8,"maxWidth":500,"fill":"#000000","fontStyle":"normal","fontWeight":"normal","stroke":"rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)","strokeWidth":1,"opacity":1,"editable":false,"version":"V2","offsetY":0.04,"h":45.2,"rotate":0,"textType":"text","lineHeight":1,"z-index":1,"font":"NotoSans","fontsize":48,"weight":"","id":"07989144-415a-40a7-a9ed-ad7ab01ce851","config":{"__cdata":"{\"opacity\":100,\"strokeWidth\":1,\"stroke\":\"rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)\",\"autoplay\":false,\"visible\":true,\"text\":\"The word algebra comes from the Arabic الجبر (al-jabr lit. \\\"the reunion of broken parts\\\") from the title of the book Ilm al-jabr wa'l-muḳābala by the Persian mathematician and astronomer al-Khwarizmi. The word entered the English language during the fifteenth century, from either Spanish, Italian, or Medieval Latin. It originally referred to the surgical procedure of setting broken or dislocated bones. The mathematical meaning was first recorded in the sixteenth century.\",\"color\":\"#000000\",\"fontfamily\":\"NotoSans\",\"fontsize\":18,\"fontweight\":false,\"fontstyle\":false,\"align\":\"left\"}"}}]},{"x":0,"y":0,"w":100,"h":100,"id":"1d505532-e5ee-4076-b70b-ed5ee90db94e","rotate":null,"config":{"__cdata":"{\"opacity\":100,\"strokeWidth\":1,\"stroke\":\"rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)\",\"autoplay\":false,\"visible\":true,\"color\":\"#FFFFFF\",\"genieControls\":true,\"instructions\":\"\"}"},"param":[{"name":"previous","value":"56b07655-a3be-4050-b389-e7e681287e84"},{"name":"next","value":"e16077ac-b508-42cc-b393-7e238c910a74"}],"manifest":{"media":[]},"org.ekstep.text":[{"x":12.36,"y":12.1,"minWidth":20,"w":38.58,"maxWidth":500,"fill":"#000000","fontStyle":"normal","fontWeight":"normal","stroke":"rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)","strokeWidth":1,"opacity":1,"editable":false,"version":"V2","offsetY":0.04,"h":5.02,"rotate":0,"textType":"text","lineHeight":1,"z-index":0,"font":"NotoSans","fontsize":48,"weight":"","id":"164c684a-b220-4d03-a4e0-a2acd07e0750","config":{"__cdata":"{\"opacity\":100,\"strokeWidth\":1,\"stroke\":\"rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)\",\"autoplay\":false,\"visible\":true,\"text\":\"Different meanings of \\\"algebra\\\"\",\"color\":\"#000000\",\"fontfamily\":\"NotoSans\",\"fontsize\":18,\"fontweight\":false,\"fontstyle\":false,\"align\":\"left\"}"}},{"x":13.75,"y":27.4,"minWidth":20,"w":73.58,"maxWidth":500,"fill":"#000000","fontStyle":"normal","fontWeight":"normal","stroke":"rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)","strokeWidth":1,"opacity":1,"editable":false,"version":"V2","offsetY":0.04,"h":65.29,"rotate":0,"textType":"text","lineHeight":1,"z-index":1,"font":"NotoSans","fontsize":48,"weight":"","id":"7d2b53de-484b-4c7c-a056-5b9438524592","config":{"__cdata":"{\"opacity\":100,\"strokeWidth\":1,\"stroke\":\"rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)\",\"autoplay\":false,\"visible\":true,\"text\":\"The word \\\"algebra\\\" has several related meanings in mathematics, as a single word or with qualifiers.\\nAs a single word without an article, \\\"algebra\\\" names a broad part of mathematics.As a single word with an article or in plural, \\\"an algebra\\\" or \\\"algebras\\\" denotes a specific mathematical structure, whose precise definition depends on the author. Usually, the structure has an addition, multiplication, and a scalar multiplication (see Algebra over a field). When some authors use the term \\\"algebra\\\", they make a subset of the following additional assumptions: associative, commutative, unital, and/or finite-dimensional. In universal algebra, the word \\\"algebra\\\" refers to a generalization of the above concept, which allows for n-ary operations.\",\"color\":\"#000000\",\"fontfamily\":\"NotoSans\",\"fontsize\":18,\"fontweight\":false,\"fontstyle\":false,\"align\":\"left\"}"}}]},{"x":0,"y":0,"w":100,"h":100,"id":"e16077ac-b508-42cc-b393-7e238c910a74","rotate":null,"config":{"__cdata":"{\"opacity\":100,\"strokeWidth\":1,\"stroke\":\"rgba(255,
